intro: Mesembryanthemum calcicola, commonly known as the limestone mesem, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is known for its diverse and often drought-tolerant species. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments. Its fleshy leaves and flowering stems are adapted to store water and withstand harsh conditions. Mesembryanthemum calcicola is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
